author: Jeffrey T. Lewis
title: Brazil Truck Strike Enters Fourth Day
text:
SÃO PAULO—Brazil’s nationwide trucking strike entered its fourth day Thursday, disrupting the country’s already-weak economy and delivering a blow to oil giant Petrobras as drivers demand lower diesel-fuel prices.
Shares of Petrobras plunged at the start of trading Thursday after it announced late Wednesday a temporary cut to the diesel-fuel price to give the government and truckers time to negotiate an agreement to end the labor action that has left many businesses short of crucial supplies.
...
